all_summaries: Knockoff-Guided Compressive Sensing (KnockoffCS) provides a statistically rigorous framework for support recovery in compressive sensing, achieving FDR control while maintaining computational efficiency and accuracy, offering significant improvements in support recovery accuracy and F1-score over traditional methods through the integration of statistical Knockoff filters with compressive sensing, validated by extensive simulations and real-world applications showing superior performance in both regression and classification tasks.

The paper proposes a novel Knockoff-guided compressive sensing framework, KnockoffCS, which integrates statistical FDR control with support recovery in compressive sensing. It addresses the challenge of false discovery in support estimation by designing measurement matrix knockoffs that enable rigorous FDR control while preserving the CS structure. The framework provides theoretical guarantees for FDR control and improves support recovery accuracy compared to traditional CS methods. Extensive experiments on synthetic and real-world data demonstrate that KnockoffCS significantly enhances support recovery performance, particularly in scenarios with correlated measurements and structured sparsity, achieving superior reconstruction accuracy and robustness in downstream tasks.
